SEARCH
Module flag4j
Package org.flag4j.algebraic_structures.semirings

Class BooleanRing

java.lang.Object
org.flag4j.algebraic_structures.BoolSemiring
All Implemented Interfaces:
Semiring<BooleanRing>
public class BooleanRing extends Object implements Semiring<BooleanRing>

A semi-ring element backed by a boolean. Immutable

This class wraps the primitive boolean type.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public BooleanRing add(BooleanRing b)

      Sums two elements of this semi-ring (associative and commutative).

      This is equivalent to logical OR

      Specified by:
      add in interface Semiring<BooleanRing>
      Parameters:
      b - Second semi-ring element in sum.
      Returns:
      The sum of this element and b.

    • xor

      public BooleanRing xor(BooleanRing b)
      Computes "exclusive OR" (i.e. xor) of elements of this semi-ring.
      Parameters:
      b - Second semi-ring element in xor.
      Returns:
      The xor of this element and b.

    • mult

      public BooleanRing mult(BooleanRing b)
      Multiplies two elements of this semi-ring (associative).

      This is equivalent to logical AND

      Specified by:
      mult in interface Semiring<BooleanRing>
      Parameters:
      b - Second semi-ring element in product.
      Returns:
      The product of this semi-ring element and b.

    • isZero

      public boolean isZero()

      Checks if this value is an additive identity for this semi-ring.

      An element 0 is an additive identity if a + 0 = a for any a in the semi-ring.

      Specified by:
      isZero in interface Semiring<BooleanRing>
      Returns:
      True if this value is an additive identity for this semi-ring. Otherwise, false.

    • isOne

      public boolean isOne()

      Checks if this value is a multiplicitive identity for this semi-ring.

      An element 1 is a multiplicitive identity if a * 1 = a for any a in the semi-ring.

      Specified by:
      isOne in interface Semiring<BooleanRing>
      Returns:
      True if this value is a multiplicitive identity for this semi-ring. Otherwise, false.

    • getZero

      public BooleanRing getZero()

      Gets the additive identity for this semi-ring.

      An element 0 is an additive identity if a + 0 = a for any a in the semi-ring.

      Specified by:
      getZero in interface Semiring<BooleanRing>
      Returns:
      The additive identity for this semi-ring.

    • getOne

      public BooleanRing getOne()

      Gets the multiplicitive identity for this semi-ring.

      An element 1 is a multiplicitive identity if a * 1 = a for any a in the semi-ring.

      Specified by:
      getOne in interface Semiring<BooleanRing>
      Returns:
      The multiplicitive identity for this semi-ring.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(BooleanRing b)
      Compares this element of the semi-ring with b.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Semiring<BooleanRing>
      Parameters:
      b - Second element of the semi-ring.
      Returns:
      An int value:
      • 0 if this semi-ring element is equal to b.
      • invalid input: '<' 0 if this semi-ring element is less than b.
      • > 0 if this semi-ring element is greater than b.
        • Hence, this method returns zero if and only if the two semi-ring elemetns are equal, a negative value if and only the semi-ring element it was called on is less than b and positive if and only if the semi-ring element it was called on is greater than b.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object b)
      Checks if an object is equal to this semi-ring element.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      b - Object to compare to this semi-ring element.
      Returns:
      True if the objects are the same or are both BooleanRing's and have equal values.
